alert.note: Alert for Blount; Cocke; Grainger; Greene; Hamblen; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Monroe; Sevier; Union (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 25 at 2:41AM CDT until March 25 at 3:45AM CDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: The National Weather Service in Morristown has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southeastern Loudon County in east Tennessee... Knox County in east Tennessee... Blount County in east Tennessee... Jefferson County in east Tennessee... Northwestern Cocke County in east Tennessee... Northeastern Monroe County in east Tennessee... West central Greene County in east Tennessee... Southwestern Grainger County in east Tennessee... Sevier County in east Tennessee... South central Union County in east Tennessee... Hamblen County in east Tennessee... * Until 445 AM EDT. * At 340 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles north of Knoxville to near Maryville to 7 miles east of Madisonville, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. * Locations impacted include... Knoxville, Morristown, Maryville, Sevierville, Alcoa, Jefferson City, Newport, Gatlinburg, Dandridge and Pigeon Forge. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 in Tennessee between mile markers 382 and 438. Interstate 75 in Tennessee between mile markers 108 and 109. Interstate 81 in Tennessee between mile markers 1 and 18. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.

area.areaDesc: Blount; Cocke; Grainger; Greene; Hamblen; Jefferson; Knox; Loudon; Monroe; Sevier; Union
